entries.femaleVariant: Hello, I'm Gillean Jordan. We begin the broadcast with troubling news from the State Line.
South California reportedly opened fire on an migrant caravan attempting to penetrate the wall.
Twenty-seven people died and another forty-seven were injured. The surviving migrants are now being held at an undisclosed facility.
This is just another in a series of similar incidents this year already. The South Californian government has, so far, declined to comment.
This tragedy further emphasizes the need for unity under President Myers's leadership. It is only under the guiding influence of the NUS government that future bloodshed can be avoided.
To sign a petition calling on the Night City Council to rejoin the Union, please visit the address at the bottom of your screen.
Stay tuned. More information after the break.
